note.p: Death: St Margaret, Westminster, London, England, Europe (18 December 1681)
Burial: Richmond, Surrey, England, Europe (22 December 1681)
Education: Merchant Taylors' School, London (1618); Pembroke College, Cambridge (BA 1625; MA 1628)
Career: Colonel or Lieutenant-Colonel in the Royalist army during First Civil War; Gentleman Usher (1660); Gentleman of the Privy Chamber (1670-1681)
Date of ejection/withdrawal: 18 November 1675 (due to non-payment of subscriptions)
Committee for improving the English language (1664)

Notes: The election date is Nott's re-election date into the Society after the grant of the second charter in April 1663. All Fellows admitted in a two-month window after this charter, until 22 June 1663, are considered Original Fellows. He was previously elected on 14 August 1661 and was admitted into the Society on 21 August 1661.
